content:
WizardNavigationEventHandler Delegate

Definition

Represents the method that will handle navigation events in a Wizard control.

In this Article

public delegate void WizardNavigationEventHandler(object sender, WizardNavigationEventArgs e);
Inheritance
Object
System.Delegate
WizardNavigationEventHandler

Remarks

The WizardNavigationEventHandler class represents the method that handles the navigation events FinishButtonClick, NextButtonClick, PreviousButtonClick, and SideBarButtonClick for a Wizard control and for controls that inherit from the Wizard control (such as the CreateUserWizard control).

When you create a WizardNavigationEventHandler delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event-handler delegates, see NIB: Events and Delegates.
